functionalRequirements:
## Business Objectives
A simple interface to display and sort AI models by key attributes

## Functional Requirements
- Display list of AI models with name, type (LLM/ML/Vision), and key metrics
- Sortable columns for: model name, specialty, performance metrics, release date
- Clear visual sorting indicators
- Responsive table layout for different screen sizes
- Option to filter by model category

## User Value
Provides quick access to compare AI capabilities while maintaining simplicity of use

## Implementation Notes
Add subtle sorting animations and maintain column alignment when sorting
title: AI Model Directory
name: AiModelDirectoryTable
userExplanation: Sortable table listing available AI models with basic metadata, enabling quick comparison and filtering by key attributes

dataRequirements.description: Sortable table displaying AI models with name, type, vendor, and performance metrics using direct entity view access

entities.name: AI Models
entities.description: Catalog of all AI Models configured in the system with type, vendor, and performance rankings
entities.usageContext: Primary data source for the AI Model Directory table - provides model information for display and sorting

fieldMetadata.name: AIModelType
fieldMetadata.description: Type/category of the AI model (e.g., LLM, Audio, Video, Vision)

fieldMetadata.name: PowerRank
fieldMetadata.description: Optional ranking of the model's power/capability (0-10)

fieldMetadata.name: SpeedRank
fieldMetadata.description: Optional ranking of the model's speed/performance (0-10)

fieldMetadata.name: CostRank
fieldMetadata.description: Optional ranking of the model's cost (0-10, lower is cheaper)

fieldMetadata.name: __mj_CreatedAt
fieldMetadata.description: When the model was added to the system

fieldMetadata.name: IsActive
fieldMetadata.description: Whether the model is currently available for use

description: A responsive, sortable table component for displaying AI models with filtering capabilities
technicalDesign:
## Component Architecture
The AI Model Directory is a self-contained table component that manages its own state for sorting and filtering while displaying AI model data.

## Data Flow
- Uses direct entity view access to the "AI Models" entity via MemberJunction's RunView system
- Supports real-time data updates through reactive data fetching
- Provides responsive table layout using AG-Grid with fallback to internal data loading

## State Management
- Internal state for sort configuration (column, direction)
- Internal state for active filters
- Internal state for data loading and error handling
- Optional external data via props (models prop) - if not provided, loads from entity

## Features
- Column sorting with visual indicators (arrows)
- Row filtering by model type and vendor
- Responsive grid layout that adapts to screen sizes
- Performance optimized for up to 1000 models
- Clean, Material-UI styled table
- Automatic data loading when no external data provided

## Implementation Details
- Uses AG-Grid React for robust table functionality
- Leverages AG-Grid's built-in sorting and filtering
- Responsive breakpoints for mobile/tablet/desktop
- Custom cell renderers for ranking display (stars/badges)
- Loading states and empty state handling
- Handles both internal data fetching and external data props gracefully

properties.name: models
properties.type: Array<{ID: string, Name: string, AIModelType: string, Vendor: string, PowerRank: number, SpeedRank: number, CostRank: number, __mj_CreatedAt: string, IsActive: boolean}>
properties.description: Optional array of AI model objects. If not provided, component will load data from the AI Models entity directly

properties.name: loading
properties.description: Loading state indicator for async data fetching. When not provided, loading state is managed internally

properties.name: onSortChange
properties.description: Optional callback fired when column sorting changes: (sortModel: SortModel) => void

properties.name: onFilterChange
properties.description: Optional callback fired when filters are applied: (filterModel: FilterModel) => void

events.name: onModelSelect
events.description: Called when a user clicks on a model row

parameters.name: modelId
parameters.description: The ID of the selected AI model

events.name: onSortChange
events.description: Called when user changes column sorting

parameters.name: sortConfig
parameters.description: Current sort configuration {colId: string, sort: string}

events.name: onFilterChange
events.description: Called when user applies or clears filters

exampleUsage:
<AiModelDirectoryTable
  onModelSelect={(modelId) => handleModelSelection(modelId)}
  onSortChange={(sortConfig) => handleSortChange(sortConfig)}
  onFilterChange={(filterConfig) => handleFilterChange(filterConfig)}
/>
